channel.title: Partitioning Hard Drive? [Disk Defrag issue]
channel.description: I have a 1TB external hard drive with about 100GB's used on it. I want to partition off 50-75 of it to put an OS (Win XP/Win7) on it. I opened Computer Management, and went To Storage > Disk Management. I went to "Shrink Volume" on E. E being my external. It said: "The service cannot be started, either because it is disabled or because it has no enabled devices associated with it. " Now, upon searching, I found that you need to turn on the disk defragmentation service. The two ways I know about doing so would be going to Start Menu > Accessories > System Tools > Disk Defragmentation. Or Go to Start and type "dfrgui" and hit enter. Neither worked, but for some reason it opened 2 instances of my Ultra Surf (Web proxy I use at school). So I'm puzzled, how do I turn on my disk defrag?

item.title: Partitioning Hard Drive? [Disk Defrag issue]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“RSCShadow, post:20, topic:518014”]Hardly any “real” web developers use Dreamweaver and Flash is garbage.

[quote author=MooningPanda link=topic=636274.msg4289986#msg4289986 date=1367068033]

I actually need Flash and dreamweaver

Lol people still use dreamweaver? … and flash?

that comment makes absolutely no sense. Dream-weaver is still commonly used and flash has dominated the market place with a larger database than java.

You see macromedia shockwave player is the outdated one.
[/quote]Flash and Java right now have two different markets. From what I’m aware of, Java is more commonly used on the server while Flash is more often used on website banner advertisements.[/quote]
I typically use Dreamweaver because both my CTS and my highschool have me do so. Otherwise I’d be using Notepad++

Read full topic

@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Travas, post:18, topic:518014”][/quote]SilentCJ is right, Adobe stopped supporting mobile devices, in favor of HTML5 technology.
[/quote]
They still have adobe air, which builds into a flash app and can be ran on iOS or andriod. Maybe in CS7/8 they won’t include it, but until the it’s still technically supported.

item.title: Partitioning Hard Drive? [Disk Defrag issue]

item.description:

I actually need Flash and dreamweaver

Lol people still use dreamweaver? … and flash?

that comment makes absolutely no sense. Dream-weaver is still commonly used and flash has dominated the market place with a larger database than java.

You see macromedia shockwave player is the outdated one.

You obviously have no idea what you’re talking about, no real web developer uses a WYSIWYG editor, and flash is being overtaken by HTML5 and JS, why do you think Adobe have dropped support completely for mobile devices?
[/quote]
You’ve got that backwards, mobile devices have dropped support for adobe flash.
But adobe got smart with AIR and made it package into the apps, so you can still use them :P[/quote]SilentCJ is right, Adobe stopped supporting mobile devices, in favor of HTML5 technology.

item.title: Partitioning Hard Drive? [Disk Defrag issue]
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:10, topic:518014”][quote author=SilentCJ link=topic=636274.msg4289714#msg4289714 date=1367018469]

Unless you guys know how to install things (EX: Adobe Master Suite) to a external and have it work properly.

Do you actually need all the CS programs or just a couple? I know I had a portable version of Photoshop CS4 a couple of years back which worked perfectly in school (hated using that Photoshop elements dumbed down shit), and judging by what you’ve said so far my school was a hundred times more technically secure, I imagine you can still get the same kind of thing these days.
[/quote]
I actually need Flash and dreamweaver
Edit again:

Here’s an example of how stupid/slow they are:
It took them until this (school) year to make the Wifi login system actually require an “email”. Before you could just type in “234u3ytgfmhtg” or even just “.” and click login. Now you can do "sdkj@ajhf.com" lol.[/quote]
last time i checked wifi only required a key

Read full topic

I had a USB running Linux, and I’d boot to that all the time.[/quote]
That’s terrible :o you could do some real damage with a Linux installation

item.title: Partitioning Hard Drive? [Disk Defrag issue]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Travas, post:4, topic:518014”]I use EaseUS Partition Master.

Partitioning your primary partition will not delete the data on it. Formatting or anything else will.[/quote]
Cool beans, I’ll just shrink it by like 75gb then.
Really, the only reason behind this is because I A) don’t like using the “Locked down” version of windows at my school, and |3) (that makes a b, B ) is a face) I can’t install some software just to the usb without certain .dll files and such, which can’t be added to the computers because, again, it’s locked down.

Read full topic

item.title: Partitioning Hard Drive? [Disk Defrag issue]
item.dc:creator: @Travas Travas
item.description:
@Travas wrote:

I use EaseUS Partition Master.

Partitioning your primary partition will not delete the data on it. Formatting or anything else will.

item.title: Partitioning Hard Drive? [Disk Defrag issue]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:2, topic:518014”]Any kind of formatting/partitioning in Windows is shite to put it bluntly, I’ve had to do many drives over the past few years and it just doesn’t cut it. For any disk management I always use Gparted, installed on Ubuntu by default, you can actually just boot to a live CD and use the application through that way.

If you desperately don’t want to go down that route though, research the ‘diskpart’ cmd application, start by typing diskpart into CMD.[/quote]
If I do partition with the 100gbs of stuff on it, will it remove it all or no? If so I’ll throw it all into a .rar or .zip and copy to my computer.

Read full topic

item.title: Partitioning Hard Drive? [Disk Defrag issue]
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

Any kind of formatting/partitioning in Windows is shite to put it bluntly, I’ve had to do many drives over the past few years and it just doesn’t cut it. For any disk management I always use Gparted, installed on Ubuntu by default, you can actually just boot to a live CD and use the application through that way.

If you desperately don’t want to go down that route though, research the ‘diskpart’ cmd application, start by typing diskpart into CMD.

Read full topic

"The service cannot be started, either because it is disabled or because it has no enabled devices associated with it. "
Now, upon searching, I found that you need to turn on the disk defragmentation service. The two ways I know about doing so would be going to Start Menu > Accessories > System Tools > Disk Defragmentation. Or Go to Start and type “dfrgui” and hit enter. Neither worked, but for some reason it opened 2 instances of my Ultra Surf (Web proxy I use at school).
So I’m puzzled, how do I turn on my disk defrag?

Read full topic
